snippet: In a rough year for many of its shoppers, adjusted financial results meant higher incentive pay for some of its executives.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column examines accounting adjustments that have allowed Walmart to increase incentive pay for some executives despite declining sales growth and poor returns for shareholders; notes that adjustments were even more liberal in 2014 than in previous years.
lead_paragraph: In a rough year for many of its shoppers, adjusted financial results meant higher incentive pay for some of its executives.
